summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing the drafting and approval of an initial letter to attorney Robbie Kaplan regarding the proper procedure for making a Touhy request for information related to Jeffrey Epstein. It outlines internal coordination on handling requests from civil plaintiffs/victims and includes draft regulatory language explaining the Touhy process.

persons.name: Robbie Kaplan
persons.context: Attorney at Kaplan & Hecker representing civil plaintiffs/victims in lawsuits related to Jeffrey Epstein, to whom the initial Touhy procedure letter is being sent.

events.title: Coordination on Epstein Touhy Requests
events.description: Internal discussion among SDNY AUSAs to designate a point person for handling Touhy requests from civil plaintiffs/victims related to Jeffrey Epstein, and to draft a response to plaintiff's counsel.

events.title: Finalization of Touhy Letter to Kaplan
events.description: Email finalizing an updated draft letter to Robbie Kaplan outlining the Department of Justice's Touhy regulations and the required procedure for formally requesting information related to Epstein.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York is coordinating internally to handle formal requests (Touhy requests) for information related to Jeffrey Epstein from civil litigation plaintiffs/victims.
Attorney Robbie Kaplan of Kaplan & Hecker is identified as counsel for civil plaintiffs seeking information, and a formal letter outlining the Touhy request procedure is being prepared for her.

The document includes extensive draft language explaining the Touhy regulations (28 C.F.R. §§ 16.21-16.29), which govern the disclosure of information or testimony from DOJ employees in proceedings where the government is not a party.
The internal emails show careful review and editing of the letter's tone and content before sending it to external counsel.
The correspondence indicates an expectation of additional requests stemming from civil litigation by alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein.
